meanings.sent1: She wanted to eternalize their love by carving their initials on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The artist hoped to eternalize his masterpiece by preserving it in a museum.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's spell accidentally eternalized the pumpkin, making it last forever.
meanings.sent4: The poet's words eternalized the beauty of the sunset in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual was believed to eternalize the spirits of the ancestors.

meanings.definition: To immortalize or make something last forever.
meanings.sent1: The hero's sacrifice eternalized his name in the annals of history.
meanings.sent2: The photographer aimed to eternalize the moment with a perfect shot.
meanings.sent3: The time capsule was buried to eternalize memories for future generations.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song eternalized the emotions of the singer.
meanings.sent5: The monument was built to eternalize the memory of fallen soldiers.

meanings.definition: To give eternal qualities to something.
meanings.sent1: The ancient legend eternalized the bravery of the warrior in folklore.
meanings.sent2: The fairy godmother's magic wand could eternalize happiness in a single touch.
meanings.sent3: The enchanted fountain was said to eternalize youth for those who drank from it.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes eternalized the beauty of the landscape on canvas.
meanings.sent5: The philosopher's words eternalized wisdom for generations to come.
